snippet.title: Trio charged after Melbourne siege
snippet.content: Three people have been charged after a lengthy stand-off with police in suburban Melbourne. Officers attended an address at Boronia after reports of an earlier assault with a firearm. They arrived about 5am on Wednesday and hours later arrested six people, including a 16-year-old boy, and discovered two young children in the residence. A 29-year-old woman was later charged with assault, criminal damage, assault with a weapon and intentionally cause injury. A second woman, 31, is charged with drug possession, while a 20-year-old man is facing robbery offences. Three other people were released without charge.
